The Annotated Civilisation:  II. Architecture

July 8, 2020

Periods/Styles

A.  CLASSICAL

B.  EARLY MEDIEVAL : Byzantine—Celtic—Merovingian—Carolingian

C.  ROMANESQUE : Cluniac—Cistercian—Norman—Italian

D.  GOTHIC & its Revivial

E.  RENAISSANCE : Early—High—Late

F.  BAROQUE : French—Italian—German—English

G.  NEOCLASSICAL : French—English—American

H.  CIVIL & MILITARY : German/Austrian—Italian—French—English—Netherlandish

I.  URBAN & LANDSCAPE : Italian—French—British—American

J.  REVIVAL, INDUSTRIAL, & MODERN


A.  Classical


🌐1 Tempio dei Dioscuri (Temple of Castor and Pollux), Regio VIII Forum Romanum, Roma (495 BC) [1,5]


Maison Carrée, Nîmes (c. 2–7) [1]


🌐 Pont du Gard, Nîmes (1C) [1]


🌐 Fontana della Pigna, Vaticano (1C) [5]


🌐 Arc de Triomphe d’Orange (c. 20–25) [1]


🌐 Colosseum/Flavian Amphitheatre, Regio III Isis et Serapis, Roma (70–80) [5]


🌐 Pantheon, Regio IX Circus Flaminius, Roma (113–125) [5]


🌐 Grandi Terme, Villa Adriana, Tivoli (2C) [5]  📖2


🌐 Arco di Settimio Severo (Arch of Septimius Severus), Regio VIII Forum Romanum, Roma (203) [5]


🌐 Terme di Caracalla, Regio XII Piscina Publica, Roma (212–217) [5]

E.  Renaissance

e1.  Early Renaissance

  (1437, Michelozzo di Bartolomeo)  [4]


🌐 Cappella Pazzi, Firenze
  (1441–78, Filippo Brunelleschi) [4]

  (1454, Luciano Laurana, Francesco di Giorgio Martini, and Maso di Bartolomeo) [4]


Basilica di Santa Maria delle Carceri, Prato
  (1486–95, Giuliano da Sangallo) [4]

  (1489–1662, Benedetto da Maiano) [4]

#contents

e2.  High Renaissance

  (1471–1605, Bramante, Michelangelo, Raphael, Antonio da Sangallo il Giovane, Carlo Maderno, Gian Lorenzo Bernini, et al.)  [5,13]


🌐 Basilica di San Pietro, Vaticano
  (1506–1626, Bernardo Rossellino, Giuliano da Sangallo, Bramante, Raffaello Sanzio, Giovanni Giocondo, Antonio da Sangallo il Giovane, Baldassarre Peruzzi, Michelangelo Buonarroti, Domenico Fontana, Giacomo Della Porta, Jacopo Barozzi da Vignola, Pirro Ligorio, Carlo Maderno, Gian Lorenzo Bernini, et al.) [1,5]

  (1720–80, Balthasar Neumann and Giambattista Tiepolo) [9]

  (1734–9, Johann Baptist Zimmermann and Joachim Dietrich) [9]

  (1743-72, Balthasar Neumann) [9]

  (1680, Victor Louis) [10]

  (1806–1836, Jean-François Chalgrin) [1,12]

  (1726–9, Richard Boyle, 3rd Earl of Burlington) [10]

g3.  American Neoclassical

  (1822–1826) by Thomas Jefferson and Stanford White [10]

  (1932–1935) by Cass Gilbert and Cass Gilbert Jr. [10]

  (1939–1947) by John Russell Pope and Eggers & Higgins [10]

J.  Revival, Industrial, & Modern

  (1848–54, 1879–84, Robert Mills) [10]

  (1963–1968, Denys Lasdun and Bernard Feilden) [13]
